results.title: Russian rooster
results.brief_description: The wild chase of hunters after a rooster becomes even more frenzied with background music of Rimsky - Korsakoffs “La Coq D’or”. The combination of music and animated figures drawn directly on the film creates an exciting visual experience. And don’t be so sure about who wins the chase.

results.title: Russian ark [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Egoli Tossell Film, Hermitage Bridge Studio, Andrei Deriaban, Andrew Deryabin, Jens Meurer, Karsten Stoter and Alexander Sokurov
results.brief_description: Hailed as a masterpiece and a breakthrough in digital cinema, this single-take, feature length film is set in the Hermitage in St. Petersburg. Throughout the piece, Sukurov uses a narrator to guide the viewer through the Hermitage past innumerable grand works, whilst also presenting history through a series of characters that appear to drift across the camera space, almost incidentally rather than deliberately. Elaborate costumes, sumptuous works of art and the ambitious scale make this a unique non-linear cinematic experience. In Russian with English subtitles. Also available on VHS [318954].

results.title: Russia: an introduction
results.brief_description: An introduction to Russian history from Peter the Great to the October Revolution. It also surveys the geography of this vast land, contemporary life in the country and cities and we visit the two main cities of Moscow and Leningrad.
results.description: An introduction to Russian history from Peter the Great to the October Revolution. It also surveys the geography of this vast land, contemporary life in the country and cities and we visit the two main cities of Moscow and Leningrad.

results.title: Russia, the missing years: the Russian Revolution
results.creator_credit: Eastern Light Productions, Close-up Cinema and Videos, John Doukas, Matthew King Kaufman and Maxim Zolotukhin
results.brief_description: Including previously unavailable footage from the Central Russian Archive, this video looks at the events of the year 1917 and attempts to pinpoint the internal struggle and crucial events in the Russian Revolution. It was a year in which anti-war sentiment was running high and Tsar Nicholas the second ceded power, two events which this documentary views as catalysts. It also provides historical footage to convey Lenin’s exile after an abortive coup attempt against the caretaker ruler, Karensky, and how in November of the same year Lenin assumed a position at the forefront of the peoples’ revolution when soldiers, sailors and factory workers successfully seized control of the country.

results.title: Russia revisisted
results.brief_description: Moving beyond the popular images of ugly labour camps and frozen wastelands, Siberia in summer is stunningly beautiful as the inahabitants take advantage of the warm weeks. In St. Petersburg, we ride up the canals, incliding the famous Winter Canal. Joy turns to sadness as the mass war graves of half a million Russians who died during the seige of Leningrad in World War II, are visited. Filmed at the time of great change, this is a compelling insight into the lives of the soviets.

results.title: Russia in Europe
results.brief_description: A survey of European Russia, west of the Ural Mountains. Shows the topography, living conditions, agriculture, waterways and chief cities of this area including Yalta on the Black Sea. The Communist form of government is discussed briefly. Heavy industry has expanded under the five and seven year plans, but the standard of living is lower than in many Western countries.

results.title: Russia beneath the sputniks
results.brief_description: In 1957 the Soviet Union put the first satellite into space, and since then has achieved other spectacular “firsts” in space. But Soviet scientists are also tackling other problems of more immediate consequence to its 200 million population. The opening up of the frozen deserts of the Arctic Circle and the discovery of minerals there; the chemical compounding of foods; and the use of computers particularly in the field of hospital surgery and medical research are a part of the quiet revolution in progress behind the closed doors of the Soviet Union.

results.title: Russell Drysdale
results.creator_credit: Collings Productions, Qantas Airways and Dahl Collings
results.brief_description: Shows the development of Australian artist, Russell Drysdale, over a period of 25 years and interprets his vision and concept. The film is based on over eighty paintings assembled from private and public collections. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Russell Drysdale
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Five Australians”.
This film shows personal interviews between Russell Drysdale and Australian author George Johnston. Their discussions centre on Drysdale’s slowly developing portrait of Johnston and closely examine the values and lifestyle of what Sidney Nolan calls “the most Australian painter”. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Russell Drysdale
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Painters, the sculptors: archival art series”.
Russell Drysdale tells of his early years, of the changes in the Australian art scene since World War II; his fascination with the “great quietness” of the landscape and the methods he employs in his painting.
